intro: Streptocarpus beampingaratrensis subsp. antankarana, commonly known as the Antankarana streptocarpus, is a rare and endemic species native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of purple and white. The plant is herbaceous, with fleshy leaves that are often covered in a fine, pubescent layer. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
